DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate that the performance of Flexima Active is non-inferior to the performance of Sensura.
DOC.brief_title: Randomized Controlled Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Performance of Flexima速 Active vs. Sensura速 in Patients With Colostomy
DOC.criteria: patient is at least 18 years old patient having a colostomy with a diameter less than 50 mm for users of midi pouches or having a colostomy with a diameter less than 65 mm for users of maxi pouches patient having a colostomy for at least 1 month patient using currently a onepiece flat ostomy appliance with closed or drainable bags patient using minimum 1 product per day with closed pouches or minimum 1 product every two days with drainable pouches patient capable to apply and remove the pouch himself or with the help of a caregiver (except health care professional) patient having a mental capacity to participate to the study (i.e. to understand the study and to answer to the questions) patient agrees to test Flexima速 Active (size midi or maxi, beige) during 14 days and Sensura速 (size midi or maxi, beige) during 14 days patient covered by social security patient receiving or having received, within the last month, chemotherapy or radiotherapy patient currently suffering from peristomal skin complications (bleeding or red and broken skin at the time of inclusion) patient currently receiving or having received within the past three weeks systemic or local steroid medication in the peristomal skin patient already participating in another clinical study or who have previously participated in this investigation pregnant or breastfeeding woman
